intro: Calobota psiloloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaf calobota, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptability, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
